description: From Medieval Latin infamosus, from Latin infamis. Displaced native Old English unhlÄ«sful.

adjectives.description: infamous (comparative more infamous, superlative most infamous)

entries.meaning: Having a bad reputation; disreputable; notorious; unpleasant or evil; widely known, especially for something scornful.

examples: This infamous deed tarnishes all involved.

entries.meaning: (UK, historical) Subject to a judicial punishment that deprived the infamous person of certain rights; this included a prohibition against holding public office, exercising the franchise, receiving a public pension, serving on a jury, or giving testimony in a court of law.
